The aim of RC42 is to contribute to the development of theory and research in social psychology on an international level, uniting professional and scientific interests of its members to work together on a local, regional, and international level.

Board

Mariane Weber
Marianne Weber (1870–1954) was a prominent German sociologist, women’s rights activist, and writer, known for her contributions to feminist theory and her role in advancing women’s rights in Germany. Born Marianne Schnitger in Oerlinghausen, she married Max Weber in 1893 and became an integral part of his intellectual and personal life.

Max Weber
Max Weber (1864–1920) was a pioneering German sociologist, philosopher, and political economist, best known for his profound impact on the study of sociology and his theories on capitalism, bureaucracy, and religion. Born in Erfurt, Prussia, Weber grew up in an intellectually vibrant environment, which significantly influenced his scholarly pursuits.

Publications

Research

Welcome to our research output section. Our mission is to disseminate high-quality, peer-reviewed papers that advance knowledge and foster intellectual growth. Here, you will find a rich collection of studies, reviews, and commentaries by leading scholars and emerging researchers.
No matching items

Published in 1998 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the foundation of the International Sociological Association, this is a first book publication covering various aspects of ISA history. Illustrated with original photographs and congress posters it offers an attractive overview of a life of an international organization. Reading the history of the ISA may help you to reflect on the definitional evolution of what is included within the boundaries of sociology.
